issue.title: Limitation of the number of pixels
issue.body:
**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

The PROXY administrator can define a limit of pixels' number returned by a WMS (example : 240'000 pixels) under the policies.
The parameters to give is width min, width max, height min, height max. Example : 0, 400,0,600

An evolution of the proxy might be to support the following parameters (to discuss...) :
- the ability to just define a "max numbers of pixels" for a given policy (the proxy then proceed to a calculation to verify if the window asked is within the limit of pixels given >> )
- the question of error management is also important and should be taken into acccount : if the max pixels is reached, should the user received an error ? in which form ? etc...


To follow...

comments.body:
**Original author :** Magoni Bruno

Hi Xavier,

Is this feature still up to date or can we remove it ?
I guess that such technical limitation is not useful as commercial model for restricting access to web service has been changed a lot...

Thanks a lot,
Bruno

**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

You are right. We can reject it.
